Reviews.Title: “Before you stay here, look around.”
Reviews.Author: farqualar
Reviews.Content: I have waited a long time before writing this review, in the hope that the 'Two MacDonnell Road' experience might get better. Now halfway through my 12 month stay, I am afraid to say, it has not. Anyway, lets start with the positives: - Good location, Botanical Gardens with a cheap taxi fare to Soho, Central, Admirality and Wan Chai; - Door staff and housekeeping are fantastic, can not do enough (and don't laugh when in front of me when I have forgot my key card for the nth time); - All areas are clean and are well kept; <<Deep Breath>> Onto the negatives: - The website advertises this place 'as a perfect place for a short term or long term stay' with the promise of a kitchenette. This kitchenette consists of a 'fridge (with a minuscule freezer) , one cooking ring and a microwave. This means for one year I have to either fry or microwave all my food. Don't get me wrong Hong Kong is one of the best places in the world to eat but sometimes I would quite like cheese on toast, sadly not an option. These facilities are fine for a couple of weeks/months but for a long term stay it is frustrating, I have asked around and for a similar price you can get better kitchen facilities; - Speaking of the freezer - it hasn't actually worked for four months, but got fixed on the third request; - Some of my possessions have been broken by staff and then replaced without actually informing me of the switch. I had to take these 'replacements' to reception before a manager came to my room and owned up to what had happened. Things do get broken and I am cool with that but, to replace something that I purchased without telling me, automatically presuming that I would not notice is, quite frankly, appalling; - There is no outside space, not unusual in Hong Kong but you can not even open a window in the room (obviously no balcony). The accommodation does have space for an outside area (it is a two tier building). On the plus side it means you will want to leave your room as much as possible and explore Hong Kong. A lot ; - I would prefer a morgue to the 'Coffee Shop', lovely view but no atmosphere. There is no bar within realistic walking distance so this place should make a killing, however having been decorated c1997, closing at 9.30pm, with bright lightening and uncomfortable seating I avoid like the plague. It is telling that unless there is a special party there is usually very few (3/4) people dining. The food is expensive compared to similar places, portions are small (and I don't think that they are attempting nuvo cuisine). If you do order room service suggest that you go for the daily special - usually fresher. However, the 'Coffee Shop' staff are hilarious, if you see the funny side of an adult with the attitude of a teenage child; - Probably my own fault this one. I paid one months room service bill but I did not get a receipt and got charged twice. I know I paid this bill (I get another bill on the same day so I get the single amount from my account which shows on my bank statement); - Careful if you are using the washing (laundry). You have to complete a form but the dry cleaning (expensive) and relatively cheap standard, washing forms are extremely similar, twice now I have used the incorrect one because they did not leave a standard form in my room. Since becoming aware of ploy I have had to request these forms be replenished, twice; - If you are using the laundry facilities, careful some of your clothes still come back quite smelly and have to send them again (it is summer here at the moment so it is a problem); - Bathroom is a little tired, there are a fair few brown stains between the floor and the bath. - This may be standard in Hong Kong, but having only stayed on two other places I can not be objective, the sound proofing a terrible. One pair of my neighbours loved each other very much, I probably don't need to explain why I know this; - Agree with the previous person who said the gym was poorly equipped, however I prefer to go for a walk so no personally no great loss. If any of the management team are reading this review, despite appearances I am not having a whinge, you have the basis of a good place here, I await your comments on the above review. A few tweaks and it would be a good place to stay. Appreciate that I am still staying here, so I do hope that I see some improvement in the next six months and would love to be able to re-write this review. If you are choosing this place to spend your own money in, think twice and look around. See what is important to you, if you are staying for a while ask a few of the guests for their options, you will may get a different view. <<Exhales>> Please note that I have rated as 'Poor' due to the overall standard of accommodation considering the published cost of the room.

Reviews.Title: “If it weren't the stunning neighborhood/views, It'd deserve three stars.”
Reviews.Author: xerophytic
Reviews.Content: Building is clearly complacent on quality- due to great location. Some posh features, + larger-than- average rooms. Unlike other reviewers, I don't give a hotel thousands of dollars- then feel like I owe them a flattering, sugar- coated evaluation. I am not being put up for free- so I have every right to critique a hotel's faults; & will... The maids did a lousy job, & worse- ignored both a stinky building entrance hall, as well as requests to honour my do-not-disturb sign. I was repeatedly called & accosted in the halls- asking if I wanted service. When I asked the maids to be quieter in the morning; they refused to comply. As I am a guest indirectly paying their wages- they should be more respectful. The constuction site adjacent- was quieter than the housekeeping there. You're paying for the prime location.

Reviews.Title: “Good accommodation in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Andrew W
Reviews.Content: If you want to be in walking distance to Central this is the place, as you can walk down in about 10 mins via the Park. Staff are very friendly and the shuttle bus is good and always on time. I would stay here again, as it is a bit cheaper than a 5 star hotel, and more of a home.

Reviews.Title: “New discovery in HK!”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Aviation
Reviews.Content: When I visit HK, I prefer to stay in Central. But the hotels are often very expensive when there is an event or exhibition going on. This week was not an exception, with the art fair took place. But fortunately enough I found this hotel(Actually it is a serviced residence, even better!!!!). It's next to the botanical garden in Central, not far away from SOHO and Lan Kwai Fong(But it's complicated to walk to there). 5min walk to the peak tram station, 10 min to the Connaught Rd Central for metro and tram, another extra 5 min to IFC/HK station. (But since it's on the hill, it's easy to go down but difficult to go up, especially in a hot humid day in HK.. walking is not very recommended..). By taxi it takes less than 5 min to IFC(25HKD), and also there is a bus going to central in front of the building. The room was spacious(by HK standard of course) and clean, and the view from the room was fantastic. Cheap room service option. Kitchen was nice and had amenities I needed for the simple cooking. Bishop Lei International or Garden YMCA are similar to this one. While Bishop Lei is better located(very close to the mid-level escaltor, easily walkable to Central or IFC) and has a swimming pool, Two Macdonnel has better rooms(btw there are no twin bed rooms here). Overall, it was a pleasant 2 days in Two Macdonnel, good value!

Reviews.Title: “A friendly long term stay in the central of HK”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a Partner traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at 2 Macdonnell rd for a month. What we love the most about this place is the location. Its so easy to get everywhere, The bus stop is only two steps away and theres always a bus coming in every 10 minutes. never had to wait long for a cab, the staff can always stop a cab for you with pleasure. Plus shuttle bus is available every morning and afternoon to take us to central which is only 10 - 15 mins away by walking. There is a supermarket At Coda plaza across the road from the hotel where you can get almost everything you need. There is no wifi on the room but you can get a small travel router, so we always has a reliable wifi. The staff always smile, says hello, and get us anything we want so quickly. So far, this is the best accommodation we had in Hongkong, and we def will be back!! We miss living in 2 macdonnell rd, and hope to come back again soon!! Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Family of 4”
Reviews.Author: JamesR888
Reviews.Content: Just come back from 10 days in HK. We chose 2 Macdonnell Road as it had a 2 bedroom unit marketed as a "Family Suite"... when we arrived the extra bed (we have 2 children) was wedged in between the dining table and the sofa in the living/dining room... I knew it would be tight space wise (this is HK afterall) but was disappointed as I was led to believe 2 single beds could fit in the second room... they sorted it out by taking the desk out of the second room and squeezing it in but it meant there was no space even to open the cupboard... The location is great. Buses from central stop right outside, as do most taxis. That for me was the best point about it. They could do better but having things such as washing up liquid and a sponge, perhaps sugar sachets, salt and pepper... this is self catering... even the most basic B&B these days offers such like. The prices are equivalent to many top hotels so I felt short changed. There is a good supermarket 2 minutes walk down the hill too for all essentials. Beds were rock hard, and very small... if you are over 5 ft 8 you feet will hang off the end.

Reviews.Title: “Good lodging option for a longer-term stay”
Reviews.Author: Babzkk
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a month in December in a Deluxe Suite (2 rooms), while my colleague stayed in a Standard Room. Both had lovely views. The staff is friendly and the place is right near a supermarket, and the park. Even nicer is that right above it is a wonderfully magical walk along Bowen Road--it hugs the mountains but is flat and affords you incredible views through the canyons of buildings, yet you are in the forest. A nice respite from the tough walks during the day! The beds are hard, though. Towels are changed every day, except the weekend, and bed linens are changed every other day. The monthly rate makes this a better choice than the Y across the street. The gym is small but the view is great. Internet is free in your room, but if you need to use a computer, the business center has one for $HK25/30 min.

Reviews.Title: “Lived here for 7 years - then I came back as a regular traveler.”
Reviews.Author: rocket4rocket
Reviews.Content: I actually lived in this place for 7 years before their big renovation. 75% of their guests were long term residents. Friendly front desk staff, same housekeeping maids assigned to a few floors, I know they keep a memo of each long staying guests special needs = personal touches! After the renovation, I returned to be a short term guest. Hotplate in kitchenette changed to induction hob - boils water in minutes! Free lan internet, direct phone line number. Clean and OK spacious - for it's price in HK it's already spacious. All kitchen utensils provided. Nice view in most rooms. Even the ones facing buildings are of a good distance. They didn't change the bathroom, so still the old ones, but well kept. Down side - 2 bedrooms suites has only 1 bathroom. Lower floor harbor facing rooms might get the mid-night cries from the monkeys in the zoo.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel stay for family”
Reviews.Author: maybeen
Reviews.Content: Kitchen in family suite was perfect for breakfast with the nearby grocery store half a block away. Refrigerator, induction range top and microwave were almost new. No wifi in the Location is excellent for access to central business district. room but there was an Ethernet outlet so ipad could only be used in lobby. Service personnel courteous and helpful. Did not expect a tip and actually refused a tip. Not as luxurious as other Hong Kong hotels. Across the street is the YWCA with cafeteria service. It also has a Chinese food restaurant that was reasonably priced and great dishes. Would definitely return again

Reviews.Title: “Great location for walking and away from noise and bustle!”
Reviews.Author: DebHO55
Reviews.Content: Lovely rooms for self contained stay, friendly staff, and good location. Local Supermarket has everything you need. Great if you like walking and exploring. However you have to like uphill climbs on the homeward bound trip from SOHO and mid levels. Shaded walk downtown through the Zoological Gardens. Not so great:- Gym very pokey and disappointing. Wifi access only available in the foyer and business centre- cable connection in room. Office desk is in main bedroom. Anything missing from room was available immediatley on request- extra bedding, kitchen needs. We will go back but many would prefer proximity to attractions- we like to be further away.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: LavenderPanda
Reviews.Content: Stayed in 1BR suite for 10 nights and loved it. Our room had beautiful views of harbour and skyline. Very comfortable quiet clean modern rooms. Kitchenette with granite breakfast bar was great. It worked out perfectly for our family with a little one (3 years old). Flat screen TV with DVD player helped us unwind on the couch after a busy day sightseeing. Convenient location with grocery store a block away. Easy access to taxis, hailed by staff. We found the staff to be friendly and helpful. We loved it! Can't wait to go back next time we're in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “101% recommended - a DEFINITE YES!”
Reviews.Author: trustme101
Reviews.Content: first time to go to hong kong, i had lots of nights spent to look for a hotel, but when i saw two macdonnel road on the net, really had me say yes. by the looks of it on the net and the price made me say yes. called their hotel, the staff i spoke with was really nice. asked if the price given had additional or hidden charges after and he said no. price was really acceptable for me. when we got to hong kong of course we had to go to the hotel first. kind of got lost and made us arrived at the hotel at night when we are supposed to be their by noon. we called the hotel and asked for directions and they were very helpful! arrived the hotel at last! the looks of the hotel from the outside was really nice. had a big "Macdonnell 2 Road" on the wall hanging and really looks cool. when we got in staff were nice. and walla! we got to our room and the room was VERY VERY NICE! super clean! and LOVELY VIEW from the window. had a kitchen too. feels like you're in a home. so complete. and the staffs are really nice. convenient too coz near some tourist attractions and bus stations. like a 5 minute or 3 minute walk to the bus station so really hasel free. I LOVED THIS PLACE AND WOULD TOTALLY GO BACK!!! I RECOMMEND THIS TO ALL TRAVELLERS WHO LOVES TO ENJOY AND TOTALL HAVE THE EXPERIENCE IN HONG KONG. GREAT FOR HONEY MOONS TOO AS THE PLACE AND LOCATION IS REALLY NICE. has a supermarket at its side too so staying here is REALLY HASEL FREE. REALLY LOVED THIS HOTEL AND HONG KONG TOO.

Reviews.Title: “Dont like the smoking policy”
Reviews.Author: TravelllersfromOz
Reviews.Content: Two Macdonnell Rd Hong Kong provides reasonably quiet, reasonably priced and reasonably spacious (by HK standards) hotel rooms (serviced apartments) in a relatively green environment (opposite the zoolological and botanic gardens). We have stayed there twice now during the last couple of weeks. There are some drawbacks: 1) the hotel does not have a non smoking policy nor non smoking rooms. We were given a room on the 14th floor and the corridor reeked of smoke. The room was better but still had a smoky smell. We asked to be relocated on the first night but were told there were no other rooms. The hotel was full. The next morning after a disturbed night a different staff member was more cooperative and found us another room; 2) the beds are very firm. Two pillows helped the discomfort; 3) the restaurant is cheap but nothing to write home about. They do not serve breakfast, the food is not fancy and the service a little curt. 4) they are serviced apartments and don't provide quite the same level of service as a hotel; 5) the shower is in the bath with a shower curtain, 6) the towels provided are relatively thin, and 7) the service is a bit patchy. All apartments have small kitchens which provide more flexibilty with eating. They have one and two bedroom apartments available. It is away from the hustle and bustle of Hong Kong, a totally different experience to Kowloon. It is a bit of a hike up the hill but taxis are cheap and the most convenient way to get around. There is a very convenient Park and Shop store across the road and three restaurants in the YWCA building across the road. Overall we found it to be quite good but would be hesitant to stay there again because of the smoking policy.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: pikachiu132
Reviews.Content: I was so pleased with this place. It was modern, clean, and perfect for a 2 week stay in hong kong. I don't know what I would do without a kitchen. You get an induction hotplate stove that heats up water in the kettle provided in about 2 mins! Fridge and microwave. Be careful, however, the microwave stays on when you open the door! Full utensils and plates/bowls/mugs/thermoskettle for hot water. The only thing missing is some soap and sponge so I can clean, however, they clean dishes for you every day. The room is spacious and excellent view on to Kennedy Road. The staff are extremely friendly. It was cold and they gladly brought me a heater. And extra pillows. Free lan internet. SHuttle buses to central in the morning and afternoons. Location is excellent and easy to get taxis. Grocery store right across the street. I have never been so comfortable in a hotel before!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay in a good location”
Reviews.Author: fdsawq
Reviews.Content: We were in HK to visit family. Their place, in Mid-Levels, was too small to accommodate all of us (2 adults and 2 children, aged 5 and 2), so we needed a place nearby, which 2MR satisfied well. It isn't close to the MTR, but we needed to take taxis anyway as the family aren't either; taxis are cheap in HK, so this wasn't much of a burden. It is about a 15 minute walk to Pacific Place. The accommodation was comfortable. We had a 2-bedroom unit, with a double in the master bedroom and a single in the 2nd bedroom, which was fine for small children. The beds were a bit hard, but everything else was fine - cable TV, free wired internet, room service, daily clean, small kitchen for breakfast. Pros: - Excellent location - nice views of the city, close to the zoo and HK Park - Very friendly and helpful staff Cons: - Beds

Reviews.Title: “Great accommodation”
Reviews.Author: buraq
Reviews.Content: To get away from the heavily populated tourist areas and stay in an area where the locals live, try Two MacDonnell Road, a quality apartment building. It's very comfortable and smart, has great views over the Botanic Gardens, the Governor's residence and the island's Central District to Kowloon. It's good value for money and only a 10 minute walk - through the gardens - to Central. At the end of the day it is only a HK$20 taxi trip from Central back to Two MacDonnell Road. The building is only about 40 metres to a very well stocked Park N'Shop, making eating-in easy if required. It's not five star, but it's pretty comfortable and a sensible choice unless you are looking for real luxury at five to 10 times the price.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and very specious.”
Reviews.Author: love-2-travel_2820
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 12 nights in October, and it was perfect. Small self catering apartment with plenty of room. Clean towels and sheets every day, they even washed the dishes and cleaned the kitchen – but it still had all other services as a hotel with room service etc. Very big and specious rooms (especially for Hong Kong standard) we stayed in a business suite or a junior suite. But it cost less then a ordinary tiny hotel room. Very easy, cheap fast access to central with taxi (or free shuttle service) We will definitely stay here again when visiting Hong Kong next time.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the view!”
Reviews.Author: cc.memories
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay in Hong Kong! We stayed in a studio apartment for 3 nights and we enjoyed using the cooking facilities, which comes with a microwave, stove, plates and knives. There is a supermart 5 mins walk down and you can stock up your breakfast in the mini-fridge. As we were there for holiday, we didn't make use of the shuttle bus (timings were too early). Instead, we took minibus 1A or bus 12A that goes directly to Central MTR. The bus stop is only 5 mins away and the last bus runs until midnight, so you can save on taxi fares. Overall, we are happy and will definitely return to stay again when we visit Hong Kong!

Reviews.Title: “Surprised in a good way...”
Reviews.Author: Commander_Pants
Reviews.Content: A friend of mine stayed over in HK about a month before me and the hotel room he got was dreadful, his view as horrible, and the room very average. So when I went over to HK I wasn't expecting, much, I was quite surprised with my stay given his experience. THE ROOM Reasonable size considering the horrible things I've heard about HK hotels. The bed was quite hard, but for the most part the room was comfortable. There was free wired internet access in the hotel. FACILITIES +Modest gym, just enough to get by. +Shuttle bus in the morning to the CBD, returning in the afternoon - several trips a day. +Coffee shop/restaurant - No breakfast, the food is pretty average, hit and miss on some items. Quite cheap though ($68-$100HK) LOCATION About a 15 minute walk from IFC, it's up a bit of a hill though so can be a pain getting back. The shuttle bus is handy though, or there's always a taxi. Enjoyed myself here, and would go again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: HappyTraveller072
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Hong Kong as a family of four, two adults, two children (5yrs, 1yr) and we were pleasantly surprised with this hotel. Although, I must admit it did look very different from the website pictures (it was renovated last year). When we arrived the service was great and the baby cot had already been set up in the room. The biggest plus was the location - we could walk pretty much everywhere we wanted to go or take a quick taxi ride to Central MTR. The Peak Tram almost goes past the door. A few downsides - the rooms were compact (but well furbished), the mattress was VERY hard and there was no breakfast service. There is a supermarket close by so we stocked up on milk, fruit etc and breakfast goodies. It was very quiet, clean, friendly and the staff were helpful. For the price, in Hong Kong, we were happy. We stayed 3 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Very Shabby”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My company put me up here on my 1st visit to HK, it is supposed to be a corp apartment. This place was probably liveable 5 years ago, but is badly in need of refurbishment. 1) They do not differentiate Smoking and Non-Smoking floors; my room was ok but my hallway REAKED of smoke. 2) Carpet was disgusting -- would not walk barefoot 3) bed was hard as a rock, like sleeping on the floor 4) Couches were uncomfortable and old, would not want to "lounge" on them. 5) Air conditioning in room was loud 6) Coffee Shop food was dreadful, and they stopped serving at 9:30pm. 1st night I got there could not get even a bottle of water. No other restaurants nearby, either, so you have to bring food from downtown. 7) Gym is a room w 2 treadmills, stairmaster, and a few weights. I would compare this to a rundown Howard Johnson's in the US. Definitely not as nice as, say, a Marriott Residence Inn in the US.

HotelInfo.Name: Two MacDonnell Road
HotelInfo.Address: No.2 MacDonnell Road, Hong Kong, China
